URLSearchParams.summary: The URLSearchParams interface defines utility methods to work with the query string of a URL.

remarks.para: URLSearchParams objects are iterable, so they can directly be used in a structure to iterate over key/value pairs in the same order as they appear in the query string, for example the following two lines are equivalent:
Although URLSearchParams is functionally similar to a , when iterating, it may suffer from some pitfalls that Map doesn't encounter due to how it's implemented.

-Polyfill of URLSearchParams in core-js
-The interface.
-Google Developers: Easy URL manipulation with URLSearchParams

URLSearchParamsURLSearchParams.summary:
The URLSearchParams() constructor creates and returns a
new object.

URLSearchParamsEntries.summary:
The entries() method of the
interface returns an
allowing iteration through all key/value
pairs contained in this object. The iterator returns key/value pairs in the same order as they appear in the query string. The key and value of each pair are strings.

URLSearchParamsHas.summary: The has() method of the interface returns a boolean value that indicates whether the specified parameter is in the search parameters.

remarks.para:
A parameter name and optional value are used to match parameters.
If only a parameter name is specified, then the method will return true if any parameters in the query string match the name, and false otherwise.
If both a parameter name and value are specified, then the method will return true if a parameter matches both the name and value.

URLSearchParamsGetAll.summary:
The getAll() method of the
interface returns all the values associated with a given search parameter as an array.
URLSearchParamsGetAll.returns: An array of strings, which may be empty if no values for the given parameter are found.

URLSearchParamsForEach.summary:
The forEach() method of the
interface allows iteration through all values contained
in this object via a callback function.

URLSearchParamsSort.summary:
The URLSearchParams.sort() method sorts all key/value
pairs contained in this object in place and returns undefined. Key/value pairs are sorted by the values of the UTF-16 of the keys. This method uses a stable sorting
algorithm (i.e., the relative order between key/value pairs with equal keys will be
preserved).

URLSearchParamsSize.summary: The size read-only property of the interface indicates the total number of search parameter entries.
URLSearchParamsSize.value: A number indicating the total number of search parameter entries in the object.

URLSearchParamsToString.summary:
The toString() method of the
interface returns a query string suitable for use in a
URL.

blockquote.para: This method returns the query string without the question mark. This is different from Location.search, HTMLAnchorElement.search, and URL.search, which all include the question mark.

remarks.para:
-The interface.
-Google Developers: Easy URL manipulation with URLSearchParams

URLSearchParamsToString.returns: A string, without the question mark. Returns an empty string if no search parameters have been set. Characters in the application/x-www-form-urlencoded percent-encode set (which contains all code points except ASCII alphanumeric, *, -, ., and _) are percent-encoded, and U+0020 SPACE is encoded as +.

URLSearchParamsGet.summary:
The get() method of the
interface returns the first value associated to the given search parameter.
URLSearchParamsGet.returns:
A string if the given search parameter is found; otherwise,
null.

URLSearchParamsDelete.summary: The delete() method of the interface deletes specified parameters and their associated value(s) from the list of all search parameters.

remarks.para:
A parameter name and optional value are used to match parameters.
If only a parameter name is specified, then all search parameters that match the name are deleted, along with their associated values.
If both a parameter name and value are specified, then all search parameters that match both the parameter name and value are deleted.

URLSearchParamsSet.summary:
The set() method of the
interface sets the value associated with a given search parameter to the given value.
If there were several matching values, this method deletes the others. If the search
parameter doesn't exist, this method creates it.

URLSearchParamsAppend.summary:
The append() method of the
interface appends a specified key/value pair as a new search parameter.

remarks.para:
As shown in the example below, if the same key is appended multiple times it will
appear in the parameter string multiple times for each value.

-
-Google Developers: Easy URL manipulation with URLSearchParams

URLSearchParamsKeys.summary:
The keys() method of the
interface returns an allowing iteration
through all keys contained in this object. The keys are strings.

URLSearchParamsValues.summary:
The values() method of the
interface returns an allowing iteration
through all values contained in this object. The values are strings.
